MaryAudioUtils

Method Detail

createSingleAudioInputStream

public static javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream createSingleAudioInputStream(java.util.Vector<javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream> audioInputStreams)
Create a single AudioInputStream from a vector of AudioInputStreams. The AudioInputStreams are expected to have the same AudioFormat.

Parameters:
audioInputStreams - a vector containing one or more AudioInputStreams.
Returns:
a single AudioInputStream
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the vector contains no elements, any element is not an AudioInputStream.

getAudioFileFormatType

public static javax.sound.sampled.AudioFileFormat.Type getAudioFileFormatType(java.lang.String name)
Return an audio file format type for the given string. In addition to the built-in types, this can deal with MP3 supported by tritonus.

Returns:
the audio file format type if it is known, or null.
See Also:
canCreateMP3(), canCreateOgg()

getAudioFileFormatTypes

public static java.lang.String getAudioFileFormatTypes()
List the available audio file format types, as a multi-line string. Each line consists of the name of an Audio file format type, followed by a suffix "_FILE" if the format can be produced as a file, and "_STREAM" if the format can be streamed.

Returns:
a multi-line string, or an empty string if no audio file types are available.

Determine whether conversion to mp3 is possible.

timedRecord

public static void timedRecord(java.lang.String filename,
                               long millis,
                               javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat audioFormat)
Record a sound file with the recording being limited to a given amount of time

Parameters:
filename - name of the sound file
millis - the given amount of time in milliseconds
audioFormat - the audio format for the actual sound file
Throws:
javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - if no recording line can be found
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the recording is stopped

timedRecord

public static void timedRecord(java.io.File targetFile,
                               long millis,
                               javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat audioFormat)
Record a sound file with the recording being limited to a given amount of time

Parameters:
filename - name of the sound file
millis - the given amount of time in milliseconds
audioFormat - the audio format for the actual sound file
Throws:
javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - if no recording line can be found
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the recording is stopped

playWavFile

public static void playWavFile(java.lang.String filename,
                               int loop)
Play back a file loop times (0 = only once). Play in the background, non-blocking.

Parameters:
filename - name of the wav file
loop - number of times the file should be repeated (0 = play only once).
Throws:
IOException,LineUnavailableException

playWavFile

public static void playWavFile(java.lang.String filename,
                               int loop,
                               boolean waitUntilCompleted)
Play back a file loop times (0 = only once). Play in the background, non-blocking.

Parameters:
filename - name of the wav file
loop - number of times the file should be repeated (0 = play only once).
waitUntilCompleted - whether or not to wait until the file has finished playing before returning.
Throws:
IOException,LineUnavailableException

stopWavFile

public static void stopWavFile()
Stop wav play back
